NORP In decisions of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE the GPE ORG prolonged the applicant ’s detention , holding that there was a contradiction between the applicant ’s statements and the evidence collected in the course of the proceedings . In addition , some documents had been forged and the prosecuting authorities could not yet identify all the perpetrators of the offences . The court made reference to the activities already carried out and gave a precise indication of the evidence that still had to be taken . Consequently , it decided that it was indispensable to separate the applicant from the other suspects and from the evidence which had not yet been secured . The court also relied on the serious nature of the charges against the applicant and the severity of the penalty he faced .
